SENT.plain: UNLABELLED: Three-dimensional visualization of renal arteries has recently been established by helical contrast-enhanced multiple detector-row computed tomographical angiography (MDCTA) in adults
So far, no information is available on its use in children
We reported two children with renal artery stenosis detected by 64-channel MDCTA
The first patient probably had fibromuscular dysplasia and the other neurofibromatosis type 1
The technique showed a left renal artery stenosis with a small left kidney in the first patient and a right renal artery stenosis in the second

CONCLUSION: MDCTA is an accurate and noninvasive imaging technique, easily performed in children, and can be used as an alternative diagnostic modality in children with suspected renovascular hypertension
